TITLE: Creating a Marpit Instance in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Initialize a Marpit instance to start converting Markdown into HTML/CSS presentations. This is the first step required before any other operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const { Marpit } = require('@marp-team/marpit') // Create Marpit instance const marpit = new Marpit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Markdown to HTML/CSS with Marpit DESCRIPTION: Convert Markdown content into HTML and CSS for a slide deck using the render method. This example shows how to render a simple heading as a slide. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // Output rendered HTML, CSS, and collected HTML comments (See "Advanced") const { html, css, comments } = marpit.render('# Hello, Marpit!') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Marpit to Create and Render a Slide Deck DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use Marpit to create a slide deck from Markdown, add a theme, render the content, and save it as an HTML file. It includes creating a Marpit instance, adding a theme, rendering Markdown, and writing the output to a file. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import Marpit from '@marp-team/marpit' import fs from 'fs' // 1. Create instance (with options if you want) const marpit = new Marpit() // 2. Add theme CSS const theme = ` /* @theme example */ section { background-color: #369; color: #fff; font-size: 30px; padding: 40px; } h1, h2 { text-align: center; margin: 0; } h1 { color: #8cf; } ` marpit.themeSet.default = marpit.themeSet.add(theme) // 3. Render markdown const markdown = ` # Hello, Marpit! Marpit is the skinny framework for creating slide deck from Markdown. --- ## Ready to convert into PDF! You can convert into PDF slide deck through Chrome. ` const { html, css } = marpit.render(markdown) // 4. Use output in your HTML const htmlFile = ` ${html} ` fs.writeFileSync('example.html', htmlFile.trim()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding a Custom Theme to Marpit DESCRIPTION: Create and add a custom theme to Marpit by defining CSS with the required @theme meta comment. This example customizes background color, text color, and heading styles. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const theme = marpit.themeSet.add(` /* @theme my-first-theme */ section { background-color: #123; color: #fff; font-size: 30px; padding: 40px; } h1 { color: #8cf; } `) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extending Marpit with Markdown-it Plugins DESCRIPTION: Enhance Marpit functionality by adding markdown-it plugins. This example shows how to integrate markdown-it-container to support multi-column blocks in slides. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const { Marpit } = require('@marp-team/marpit') const markdownItContainer = require('markdown-it-container') // Create the extended Marpit instance const marpit = new Marpit().use(markdownItContainer, 'columns') // Setting default theme for styling multi-column marpit.themeSet.default = marpit.themeSet.add(` /* @theme custom-container */ section { padding: 50px; } .columns { column-count: 2; } `) // Render HTML and CSS from Markdown that includes custom container const { html, css } = marpit.render(` ::: columns Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur, adipisicing elit. Perspiciatis perferendis, dolorem amet adipisci quas rem iusto excepturi ipsam aperiam quo expedita totam a laborum ut voluptatibus voluptate fugit voluptatem eum? ::: `) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Container Elements in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Specify custom HTML container elements for slides and their content. This helps with CSS scoping and structuring the output HTML for presentations. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const { Marpit, Element } = require('@marp-team/marpit') const marpit = new Marpit({ container: [ new Element('article', { id: 'presentation' }), new Element('div', { class: 'slides' }), ], slideContainer: new Element('div', { class: 'slide' }), }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tweaking Theme Style with Global Directives in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize theme styles using the style global directive instead of HTML style elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- theme: base-theme style: | section { background-color: #ccc; } --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using :root Pseudo-class in Marpit Themes DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the :root pseudo-class selector in Marpit themes, which targets each slide's section element, with rem units for relative sizing. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* @theme marpit-theme */ :root { width: 1280px; height: 960px; font-size: 40px; padding: 1rem; } h1 { font-size: 1.5rem; color: #09c; } h2 { font-size: 1.25rem; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Markdown-it Parser Options in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Customize the behavior of the underlying Markdown parser by passing options to the markdown-it initializer. This example enables HTML tags and automatic line breaks. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const marpit = new Marpit({ markdown: { html: true, // Enable HTML tags breaks: true, // Convert line breaks into `
` }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using @import-theme with Sass in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the @import-theme rule with Sass preprocessor to import a base theme while using Sass variables for styling. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` $bg-color: #f80; $text-color: #fff; @import-theme 'base'; section { background: $bg-color; color: $text-color; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Marpit Plugin in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a Marpit plugin using the marpitPlugin helper function. It provides access to the Marpit instance and allows for adding custom directives or themes. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { marpitPlugin } from '@marp-team/marpit/plugin' export default marpitPlugin(({ marpit }) => { // Add your plugin code here (Add theme, define custom directives, etc...) /* marpit.customDirectives.local.yourDirective = (value) => { return { yourDirective: value } } */ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Local Directives for Background Color Setting in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates local directives that apply a background color setting to the current slide and all following slides. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` This page has aqua background. --- The second page also has same color. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Header and Footer in Marpit Slides DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add consistent header and footer content across multiple slides using directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- header: 'Header content' footer: 'Footer content' --- # Page 1 --- ## Page 2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Inline SVG Slides in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Turn on the experimental inline SVG slide feature. This allows slides to be rendered as SVG elements for better scaling and compatibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const marpit = new Marpit({ inlineSVG: true, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resizing Images Using Width and Height in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Examples of resizing images using width and height keyword options in Marpit Markdown. Options include setting specific dimensions using various CSS length units. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![width:200px](image.jpg) ![height:30cm](image.jpg) ![width:200px height:30cm](image.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Basic Slides with Horizontal Rulers in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to create a simple two-slide deck in Marpit by using horizontal rulers (---) to separate different slides. Each slide has a heading and content. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/markdown.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Slide 1 foo --- # Slide 2 bar ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Background Size in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of specifying the size of a background image using keywords that follow CSS background-size style in Marpit Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg contain](https://example.com/background.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering HTML as Array in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Render Markdown into an array of HTML strings, one for each slide, by using the htmlAsArray option. Useful for processing slides individually. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const markdown = ` # Page 1 --- # Page 2 ` const { html } = marpit.render(markdown, { htmlAsArray: true }) /* [ '
\n

Page 1

\n
\n', '
\n

Page 2

\n
\n' ] */ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Styling Pagination in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the appearance of page numbers by styling the section::after pseudo-element that displays pagination. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* Styling page number */ section::after { font-weight: bold; text-shadow: 1px 1px 0 #fff; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting a Default Theme in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Specify a default theme for Marpit to use when no theme directive is provided in the Markdown. This makes the theme available without explicit selection. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` marpit.themeSet.default = marpit.themeSet.add('...') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Skipping Pagination on Title Slide in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to exclude the title slide from pagination by setting the paginate directive on the second slide. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Title slide This page will not have pagination by lack of the `paginate` directive. --- Pagination will render from this slide onwards (starting at 2). ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using HTML Comments for Directives in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use HTML comments to specify directives in Marpit Markdown, setting theme and enabling pagination. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Paginate Hold in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to exclude a page from pagination count while keeping the pagination display visible. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- paginate: true --- # Slide 1 [](./assets/image_01.png) > Page 1 of 1 --- # Slide 2 [](./assets/image_02.png) > Page 1 of 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using YAML Front-matter for Directives in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use YAML front-matter syntax to specify directives at the beginning of a Marpit Markdown document. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- theme: default paginate: true --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Custom Global Theme Directive DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a custom global directive that adds a dollar-prefixed alias for the built-in theme directive. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` marpit.customDirectives.global.$theme = (value, marpit) => { return { theme: value } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Spot Directive for Pagination Control in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows an alternative way to control pagination on specific slides using spot directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- paginate: true _paginate: false # or use `_paginate: skip` --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom Color Preset Directive DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates implementing a custom local directive that defines color presets for slides. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` marpit.customDirectives.local.colorPreset = (value, marpit) => { switch (value) { case 'sunset': return { backgroundColor: '#e62e00', color: '#fffff2' } case 'dark': return { backgroundColor: '#303033', color: '#f8f8ff' } default: // Return an empty object if not have to assign new values return {} } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting 4:3 Slide Size in Marpit DESCRIPTION: CSS snippet for changing the default 16:9 slide size to a classic 4:3 format by modifying the section dimensions. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* Change to the classic 4:3 slide */ section { width: 960px; height: 720px; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing and Building Marpit Framework DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the Marpit repository from GitHub and setting up the development environment. Includes installation of dependencies and building the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/marp-team/marpit cd marpit npm install npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Slide Background in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of setting a slide background image using the 'bg' keyword in the alternate text of an image in Marpit Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg](https://example.com/background.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Collecting Presenter Notes from Comments in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Extract HTML comments from Markdown as presenter notes. Comments are collected per slide and returned in the render result as a two-dimensional array. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const { comments } = marpit.render(` # First page --- ## Second page `) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Multiple Backgrounds in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of defining multiple background images that will be arranged in a horizontal row in Marpit Markdown when inline SVG slide mode is enabled. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/0288d1/fff/?text=A) ![bg](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/02669d/fff/?text=B) ![bg](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/67b8e3/fff/?text=C) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Theme Metadata in CSS DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define the required @theme metadata in a CSS comment, which is mandatory for all Marpit themes. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* @theme name */ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Vertical Multiple Backgrounds in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of defining multiple background images with vertical alignment using the 'vertical' direction keyword in Marpit Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg vertical](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/0288d1/fff/?text=A) ![bg](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/02669d/fff/?text=B) ![bg](https://fakeimg.pl/800x600/67b8e3/fff/?text=C) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Shorthand Width and Height Options in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of using shorthand width (w) and height (h) options to resize images in Marpit Markdown, which is useful for concise dimension specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![w:32 h:32](image.jpg) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Ordered Lists with Fragmentation in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create regular ordered lists with '.' and fragmented ordered lists with ')' markers. The fragmented version enables sequential appearance of items. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/fragmented-list.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Ordered list 1. One 2. Two 3. Three --- # Fragmented list 1) One 2) Two 3) Three ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Basic Marpit Theme with CSS DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a theme CSS file for Marpit by defining styles for section elements and headings, with the required @theme metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* @theme marpit-theme */ section { width: 1280px; height: 960px; font-size: 40px; padding: 40px; } h1 { font-size: 60px; color: #09c; } h2 { font-size: 50px; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Custom Color Presets in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the custom color preset directive in Markdown slides. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Sunset color preset --- # Dark color preset --- # Sunset color preset ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing a Theme with @import in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a customized theme by importing a base theme and overriding specific styles using the CSS @import rule. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* @theme customized */ @import 'base'; section { background-color: #f80; color: #fff; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring CSS for Viewport Scaling DESCRIPTION: CSS configuration to enable pixel-perfect scaling of slide pages to viewport dimensions SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/inline-svg.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* Fit slide page to viewport */ svg[data-marpit-svg] { display: block; width: 100vw; height: 100vh; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Theme in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a theme for the slide deck using the theme global directive. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Regular Slide Syntax Comparison for Heading Divider in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows the regular syntax for creating multiple slides using explicit slide separators. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # 1st page The content of 1st page --- ## 2nd page ### The content of 2nd page Hello, world! --- # 3rd page ðŸ˜ƒ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Marpit Class in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import the Marpit class using default export in JavaScript. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import Marpit from '@marp-team/marpit' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Structure Generated by Header and Footer Directives DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the HTML structure that is generated when header and footer directives are used in Marpit. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Header content

Page 1

Footer content
Header content

Page 2

Footer content
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Multiple Marpit Classes in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to import multiple Marpit classes using named exports in JavaScript, which is recommended for TypeScript users. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { Element, Marpit, Theme, ThemeSet } from '@marp-team/marpit' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling CSS Transitions in Print Style for Marpit DESCRIPTION: Disables CSS transitions and animations in the print style to improve print output. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### Fixed - Disable CSS transitions and animations in the style for print ([#238](https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/issues/238), [#239](https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/pull/239)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Heading Divider in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the headingDivider directive to automatically create new slides at headings. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # 1st page The content of 1st page ## 2nd page ### The content of 2nd page Hello, world! # 3rd page ðŸ˜ƒ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Scoped Keyframe Support in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Adds support for scoped keyframe names in # Tweak style through Markdown You would see a yellow slide. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Scoped Styles in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to apply styles to specific slides only by using # Red text --- # Blue text (only in the current slide page) --- # Red text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Split Background Layout in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a split background layout where the image takes the left half and content shrinks to the right side in Marpit Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg left](https://picsum.photos/720?image=29) # Split backgrounds The space of a slide content will shrink to the right side. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Split and Multiple Backgrounds in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of combining split and multiple background images where content shrinks to the left side while multiple images appear on the right in Marpit Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg right](https://picsum.photos/720?image=3) ![bg](https://picsum.photos/720?image=20) # Split + Multiple BGs The space of a slide content will shrink to the left side. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Header and Footer Content in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows how to format header and footer content using Markdown syntax including bold, italic, and images. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- header: '**bold** _italic_' footer: '![image](https://example.com/image.jpg)' --- NOTE: Wrap by (double-)quotes to avoid parsed as invalid YAML. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Class Directive for Slide Styling in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to apply a CSS class to a slide using the class directive to control its layout and styling. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # THE LEADING HEADER ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Background Styles in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set gradient backgrounds and color combinations using Marpit's background directives in Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` Gradient background --- Black background + White text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendered HTML Output for Fragmented Lists in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows the HTML structure generated for both regular and fragmented lists, including data-marpit-fragment attributes for numbered fragments and data-marpit-fragments for section count. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/fragmented-list.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

Bullet list

  • One
  • Two
  • Three

Fragmented list

  • One
  • Two
  • Three
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Base Theme in Marpit DESCRIPTION: A simple base theme CSS that defines basic colors for slides which can be imported and extended by other themes. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` /* @theme base */ section { background-color: #fff; color: #333; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Split Background Size in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a split background with a custom size specified by percentage (33%) in Marpit Markdown, allowing precise control of the background area. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/image-syntax.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ![bg left:33%](https://picsum.photos/720?image=27) # Split backgrounds with specified size ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic HTML Structure for Marpit Slides DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the fundamental HTML structure used in Marpit where each
element represents a slide page, similar to reveal.js. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/theme-css.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

First page

Second page

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Paginate Skip in Marpit Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to both exclude a page from pagination count and hide the pagination display. SOURCE: https://github.com/marp-team/marpit/blob/main/docs/directives.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Slide to exclude This page will not update the page number and also not show the pagination ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CSS Example for Themed Slide Layout in Marpit DESCRIPTION: Shows a CSS rule that might be included in a theme to style slides with a specific class.
